import React from 'react'; //import Header from './Header'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; //import Timer from './Timer'; export default function Start() { return (
E-Pariksha
{/*
Some Rules of this Quiz
*/}
{/*
Centralised Course End Examination (CCEE) Online PG Diploma September 2021 batch
*/}
INSTRUCTIONS TO STUDENTS


Students should read the following instructions before starting the Web-based examination:
1. The clock will be set at the server. The countdown timer at the top right corner of screen will display the remaining time available for you to complete the examination. When the timer reaches zero, the examination will end by itself. You need not terminate the examination or submit your paper.
2. Students are recommended to use either a laptop or desktop during exam with web camera, mic and with sufficient internet bandwidth. Students must give preference to Laptop.
3. Students must keep the laptop sufficiently charged so that it can last up to 3 hours.
4. Students will get login credentials for each exam through email one day before the exam.
5. Students must keep with them a hard copy of their Training centre ID card, as it is required to be shown at the time of registration. Students are required to carry another Government approved photo ID card, mainly Aadhar/PANCARD and the same also needs to be shown to the Proctor for verification, if asked for.
6. In case of any problem regarding the link not received or link not working, students should contact their respective Course Coordinator.
7. In case of re-login under unavoidable circumstances, power failure, internet failure, etc. student should re-login within 10 minutes.
8. Students will not be allowed to login after 30 minutes from the start of the exam.
9. Each exam will have two sections, one section for each module. Students need to attempt all questions compulsorily. He/she can click on question number to progress.
10. Once student reaches the last question of the 1 st section, Next section button will get enabled.
11. Each objective-type question has four choices, of which only one is correct.
12. Marking scheme of CCEE is as follows: a. +1 (plus one) mark for each correct answer. b. 0 (zero) mark for each wrong answer.
13. Once the exam is started: a. DO NOT CLOSE THE BROWSER ANYTIME DURING THE EXAM. b. Students should not try to open any other software application on the computer system during the exam. It leads to closing of the exam (Mettl Secure Browser-MSB) directly. c. Students should remain seated in front of the webcam. There will be red / orange flag warnings in given below cases; i. Student looking away from screen ii. Student not present in front of the screen iii. Multiple people present in front of the screen iv. Use of mobile phone v. Partial body detection vi. Partial face detection vii. Away from the test window d. Students MUST ensure that no other person is present in the room and should sit in a noise less space during the exam to avoid warnings. e. Any external help in any form is strictly not allowed during the exam. f. Proctor/Invigilator may pause the exam in case of a warning. If a student is found cheating, C-DAC reserves the right to end his/her exam and re-login will not be permitted at any cost. g. Students can use blank sheets for rough work. Students can use the same only for rough work and not for any external help. If Proctor/Invigilator finds his/her activity malicious, then he/she has all rights to end the exam immediately. h. If a student identifies a question/option as wrong, he/she should inform the same to the Proctor/Invigilator immediately.
14. Students should not press the Finish Test button unless he/she completes both the sections.
General Instructions: 2. The Question Palette displayed on the right side of screen will show the status of each question using one of the following symbols: You have not visited the question yet. You have not answered the question. You have answered the question. You have NOT answered the question, but have marked the question for review. You have answered the question, but marked it for review. The Mark For Review status for a question simply indicates that you would like to look at that question again. If a question is answered, but marked for review, then the answer will be considered for evaluation unless the status is modified by the candidate. Navigating to a Question : 3. To answer a question, do the following: 1. Click on the question number in the Question Palette at the right of your screen to go to that numbered question directly. Note that using this option does NOT save your answer to the current question. 2. Click on Save & Next to save your answer for the current question and then go to the next question. 3. Click on Mark for Review & Next to save your answer for the current question and also mark it for review , and then go to the next question. Note that your answer for the current question will not be saved, if you navigate to another question directly by clicking on a question number without saving the answer to the previous question. You can view all the questions by clicking on the Question Paper button. This feature is provided, so that if you want you can just see the entire question paper at a glance. Answering a Question 4. Procedure for answering a multiple choice (MCQ) type question: 1. Choose one answer from the 4 options (A,B,C,D) given below the question, click on the bubble placed before the chosen option. 2. To deselect your chosen answer, click on the bubble of the chosen option again or click on the Clear Response button 3. To change your chosen answer, click on the bubble of another option. 4. To save your answer, you MUST click on the Save & Next 5. Procedure for answering a numerical answer type question 1. To enter a number as your answer, use the virtual numerical keypad. 2. A fraction (e.g. -0.3 or -3) can be entered as an answer with or without "O" before the decimal point. As many as four decimal points, e.g. 12.5435 or 0.003 or -932.6711 or 12.82 can be entered. 3. To clear your answer, click on the Clear Response button 4. To save your answer, you MUST click on the Save & Next 6. To mark a question for review, click on the Mark for Review & Next button. If an answer is selected (for MCQ/MCAQ) entered (for numerical answer type) for a question that is Marked for Review, that answer will be considered in the evaluation unless the status is modified by the candidate. 7. To change your answer to a question that has already been answered, first select that question for answering and then follow the procedure for answering that type of question. 8. Note that ONLY Questions for which answers are saved or marked for review after answering will be considered for evaluation. 9. Sections in this question paper are displayed on the top bar of the screen. Questions in a Section can be viewed by clicking on the name of that Section. The Section you are currently viewing will be highlighted.






) }
